Wc0vlqiQzf-fatgHZCJPZg.text: Zizzi wasn't particularly bad, and I've no complaints. Yet, I don't think I'll be a regular.   The only reason I decided to come here for dinner was because I had a gift card. We were there between lunch and dinner times for a late lunch and the restaurant was lacking in atmosphere.  The calzone was HUGE, definitely a case of quantity over quality as I was most blown away by the generous portion as opposed to the filling and flavours. Service was friendly too. Perfectly A-OK; nothing blowing me away.  Other than that, I don't have a whole lot to say other than that Edinburgh has far more interesting places to eat and some awesome little hidden gems worth seeking out. - All things considered, Zizzi is fairly unoriginal.

ojCHiQSKuRRBP22ftupEFA.text: I ordered the Casareccia Pollo Piccante pasta on the waitress's recommendation, and its described as a pasta with spicy piccante chicken in a creamy sauce with fresh tomatoes and baby spinach. No. Just no. This was some of the most mediocre and lacking pasta I've ever had. First off, the sauce was more watery and runny than creamy, and I was not a fan. There were maybe 2 tomatoes total. The chicken pieces were tough and I prefer my chicken more tender. And the overall flavors were lacking, and more on the bland side than anything else. So clearly I did not like my main dish.   But at least the dessert turned out well. I ordered the Vegan caramelized biscuit cheesecake, which was a dairy-free cheesecake on a cinnamon biscuit base with crushed honeycomb. It was definitely good for a vegan dessert. I liked the added texture of the honeycomb (cereal?) crumbs and bits they added on top.  Total was 18.25 pounds and wasn't worth it considering how little I liked my main dish.

photos.caption: Photo of Zizzi Restaurants - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Vegan caramelized biscuit cheesecake- good.
Photo of Zizzi Restaurants - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Casareccia Pollo Picante pasta- mediocre &amp; bland.

JKDzhOqg86I7mWpmIDwUrQ.text: I would say Don't go.  Food has no flavor.  When I pointed out to the manager my red sauce was very watery she said, "That is the quality of our sauce."  My husband had pizza that he request that chicken be added.  The waitress took it back to the kitchen and they threw some chicken it and brought it back to the table. It didn't have any flavor either.

qRq-rrDOmbqm1o5iGBOldQ.text: The pizza here was pretty good, but then again I'm comparing back to the states. Service was not so great - took a while to get our food, and a while to get the check. 4 stars for the pizza and 3 for service

photos.caption: Photo of Zizzi Restaurants - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Forget what kind but it was pretty good

1bEfigdYrMC3ZM1B6n_wPA.text: Not sure what to say except that the waitress was very nice and professional. My son and I ordered Pasta and it was the blandest food we have tasted in a long while. I had the King Prawn Pasta which was supposed to be spicy but it was like someone had thrown a spoonfull of chili powder over a skimpy and bland sauce. I had to marvel at how they managed to cook something so devoid of any kind of flavour? I mean... tomatoes? My son in the meantime was rejecting his Spaghetti Pomodoro for the same reasons. The waitress came and seemed to know what the problem was and refunded part of the meal and was professional. Disappointing and NEVER again! FAIL!

sspYZzsBWY6bcpuve4b3AA.text: I like thin pizza a lot. I ordered green goddess salad as my main dish. Unfortunately, the staff forgot my order and when they brought side salad (very small and dry salad) which cost us 3.5.

8EK16xKmnXyG0x_pFC9TOQ.text: I am on their mailing list so had a 30% discount voucher off all main courses.  I met up with the girls for an early dinner after work and we had calzone and garlic bread.  They don't have any veggie calzones on the menu but did do one on request.  The mushroom calzone was actually very tasty and I loved the rosemary garlic bread with sea salt on top.  Not bad price too with the voucher.  I ordered a sprite and asked for no ice and a straw, they did a weird thing of pouring into a short tumbler but then adding a long straw that just kept falling out the glass as it didn't fit.  I quickly ditched that.    I liked the food and the new decor but the tables were squished too close together and it took an age to get the bill.  The decor and food are great, the staff were wandering about a bit and not achieving much!

_KAZhLODe4jgMpmJ84DsKg.text: when trying to book a table the last friday before christmas i was stuck.  phoning a few places clearly showed that even at 6pm they were all booked solid for the evening and with a my fingers crossed and last bit of hope i phoned Zizzi to see if there was the chance of a free table.  the man who answered the phone very happily assured me that there was and took my booking.  now i know edinburgh is all about the independent restaurants and bars, but sometimes the reliability of a chain does come in handy.  especially when you're wanting a relatively quick dinner at a decent price.  when we arrived friday we were shown a table in the middle of the dining room but after seeing another couple more from a table near the window which appeared quieter we asked to be moved there.  they happily accomdated us and we were soon sat contemplating menus.  after a rather lengthy wait trying to get our waitress' attention we eventually managed to order and food arrived shortly.  i think it's hard to do italian wrong and Zizzi definitely is a place that gets it right.  i had a chicken and spinach calzone which was really quite good, full of spinach and a bechamel sauce with a dried ham on top.  it could have used a bit more chicken but overall it was quite good.  the white wine we got with the meal was easy to drink and a good price.  the only downfall was the wait to actually order food when it appeared our waitress had actually forgotten that we existed.  however for a quick meal on one of the busiest friday nights of the year this was a good option.

WJiJKfmDSp1xGDRRcTS9rg.text: Bland and generic sums it up really.  I ordered a skinny Pizza( guaranteed to be under 500 calories) and It was like chewing cardbboard ( not that I have ever munched on cardboard, but you know what I mean) I should have gone for the full fatty pizza, which I have to say are pretty tasty, So if you do go to zizz's order a pizza as they are they best option on the menu. The pasta dishes are created by the chef who then  thin decides what should go into it instead of what you order/expecitng. Value wise it isnt bad but I think youd be better going elsewhere for 8-13 per main course. The decor is sligtly clinical with all the metalic tables and everytme I removed myself from the table I banged my head on a low light and I am only 5'5 ish ( 5'8 with hair bun) so its not the best designed. Its an ok establishment for meeting for a quick meal and catch up with friends, but If I wanted to make it a special occasion then Id choose somewhere else.

J1m3KvxdqOpDlBpsHuMqBg.text: Blah blah blah, the most boring place on Earth.  Not bad, just not as good as anything else Edinburgh has to offer if you put a little bit of effort into finding somewhere a little more stylish and unique. It's a chain that serves bland Italian food to work nights out - come on people, keep our independent restaurants afloat by not going to mass-money-makers like this.   You can tell when a restaurant is run by the accountants and not a real passion for food.

photos.caption: Photo of Zizzi Restaurants - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. photo from official website
Photo of Zizzi Restaurants - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. photo from official website

aBcPXwrz19rDpB5sqqUm7g.text: I hate to kick a restaurant when it's down, but I couldn't agree with the other reviewers more when it comes to this place. A real let down, and I wanted to like it so much!  A friend, who lives in Edinburgh, invited me for dinner one night when she had a massive cooker disaster. It totally died on her so we had to decide whether to eat in or take out, so we opted to get the heels on and make a night of it. Zizzi's had been recommended to my friend by her college lecturer, so we decided to try that.  It is the fast food joint of 'Italian' restaurants. Everything looks smashing on paper but just falls short of the mark in a lot of ways.  -Olives and bread with dipping oil. Good, but not enough for two ravenous girls like us. -Garlic bread. Tasteless. I think she may have misheard us and just brought us bread sans garlic. -Linguine Gamberini. My usual prawn and tomato pasta. Lacking in something, namely the prawns which I think must have been some of the smallest I have seen. Not impressed. It was also cold, not sure how they managed that one.  Not good guys. I would like to think we caught them on an off day but sadly, by the looks of other reviews, perhaps its just like this at all times.

photos.caption: Photo of Zizzi Restaurants - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

3byCyNcEAdPPGP0z0oE0bQ.text: Nice place , crowded almost always but in a good way,   food was ok , nothing special !   staff were friendly!   prices are ok!   wouldn't really choose to go back unless i had no other choice lol

f5DB3sdTxvffquEx63DmTQ.text: Quite a good restaurant for a nice chilled out bite to eat. They have a good Italian menu with nice pastas on offer. The staff are very helpful and friendly but they do not really wear a uniform which can be a bit confusing if it is busy.  However the last time I went the menu had just changed over to the summer menu and the prices had gone up, thr portion sizes had went downa nd the pasta was overcooked, hopefully this was just a one off though as it is usually very nice!

0iQm2DOu8LFtCMJbLE3FnQ.text: Zizzi doesn't pretend. It's a chain eatery and suffers from all of the drawbacks associated with that, such as a bland atmosphere, generic decor, and generally un-Italian ambiance. But don't let that fool you, as the food is great for the most part. The calzone I had on my last visit was copious and very tasty, and the pizzas my table ordered were delicious and still managed to taste authentic. One of my friends, however, ordered pasta and was not very impressed, but he works as a chef so might be biased! The service is also really good, they are friendly and not overbearing and give you the right level of attention. Also, as far as locations go, you can't much more central than Zizzi. Whether you want to ramble through the old town after your meal or go drinking in the trendy new town area, you're only a brief stride from either.

vJnX-vWMXm1oHlQUDLt7pQ.text: The food was reasonable, not amazing, and since they had lost our reservation, we were squeezed into a corner near the bar, I doubt I would bother going back!

tn944S9yZECsUVgdQGIKPA.text: I have only ever been to this Zizzi once and everything about it screams average, my friend and I only went because of a two for one offer that I'd come across. When we arrived at the restaurant, it took ages for us to get a seat because of the throngs of office workers taking up all the tables. Although the restaurant was physically clean, it seemed a bit grotty to me (like the way that a McDonald's is grotty). Our food was pretty standard; I had a pizza, which was freshly baked but could just as easily have been one of Tesco's Finest, and my friend had a seafood pasta, which was somewhat lacking in seafood. The service was alright, but not particularly friendly or quick. I don't think I shall be returning.

OsEiGw7_DQ7zgMCG0UjEgA.text: The food here is FANTASTIC. I went for lunch with my dad the other day, which came to around 25 with a glass of wine and it's well worth it. There's a nice atmosphere and the food is good quality, but the staff were a bit snappy and impatient, so only four stars.

nvUe_sPcvfA9dVbgyTeyFQ.text: There's something 'safe' about eating somewhere like Zizzi's and we weren't disappointed. Friendly staff, good service and delicious food, all for a reasonable price. Gets busy so book or go early to avoid the crowds.
